Learning HTML

Sep 22, 2016

In Wednesday’s class, we set up our websites using Jekyll themes. Now, it’s time to figure out how to incorporate HTML into posts. I’m going to display a few things that I learned from some HTML tutorials here. I mainly used w3schools to learn more about HTML.

You can add images from links to a page like this:


<img src="http://az616578.vo.msecnd.net/files/2016/08/05/636059648322773598-977331982_Aaaaaawwwwwwwwww-Sweet-puppies-9415255-1600-1200.jpg" style="width: 50%; height: 50%"/>

Result:

I also learned something else really cool: how to embed iframes. If I wanted to embed a YouTube video, I could do this:

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hQUJZGtoV-4" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Result:
